alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:22AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with torrential rainfall will impact portions of central El Paso County through 600 AM MDT... At 521 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Peyton to Colorado Springs. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Colorado Springs, Fountain, Peyton, Schriever AFB, Security, Peterson AFB, Security-Widefield, Falcon, Fort Carson and Cimarron Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft
